title: James Bond ‘marries Madeleine Swann’ in No Time To Die as filming ends
text:
James Bond is set to marry Madeleine Swann in No Time To Die (Picture: Getty Images)

James Bond is finally about to settle down as new reports suggest the suave superspy will get married to Madeleine Swann in No Time To Die.

The 25th instalment of the Bond franchise – which will be Daniel Craig’s last movie in the iconic role – will apparently see Madeleine and James tie the knot, but she will be keeping her maiden name.

Filming has officially wrapped on No Time To Die, which was co-written by Fleabag creator Phoebe Waller-Bridge, and a source has claimed the former playboy spy is looking to settle down in the latest film.

A source revealed that scenes in the movie will see James say to Madeleine, played by Léa Seydoux, ‘Morning, Mrs Bond’.

Madeleine then replies: ‘Don’t you mean Ms Swann?’, with the source telling The Mirror: ‘After Madeleine’s response Bond looks at her in an admiring way.

‘It’s why he married her. She, like him, is tough and independent. The daughter of a gangster.’

Filming finished for the movie on 25 October, and No Time To Die is set to be released on 3 April 2020.

Filming on No Time To Die has wrapped (Picture: Instagram)

The film’s official 007 Instagram account announced that filming had been completed, telling fans: ‘That’s a wrap on #NoTimeToDie. See you in cinemas April 2020. #Bond25’.

It will be the fifth and final time Daniel Craig plays Bond, and he thanked the cast and crew for their ‘hard work’ during the wrap party in Matera, Italy.

He told them: ‘I just want to say, and I am really quite drunk now so I won’t go on for long, this has been the best, most wonderful experience I have ever had!

No Time To Die is Daniel Craig’s last time playing James Bond (Picture: Universal)

‘You have all done the most amazing job. I could not be more proud to work with every single one of you.

‘I would like to thank you for this evening, for Barbara [Broccoli], for putting it on. Thank goodness, we did this tonight.’

The plot of the film is a closely guarded secret, with three endings having been reportedly filmed to avoid details of the finale being leaked.

The conclusion is so secret, in fact, that not even Daniel knows which ending will be chosen as the only person who knows the fate of Bond is director Cary Joji Fukunaga, who took over the project from Danny Boyle.

No Time To Die will be released on 3 April, 2020.
